summary: This has happened multiple times. The ignition will cut off which make the car engine quit running. Loss of braking, steering, power has left me in the middle of intersections being nearly avoided being ran into. When this happens all the warning lights come on and the engine turns off.  The exact problem VW recall number 28H1 is affecting my vehicle.

The contact owns a 2010 Volkswagen Routan. The contact stated while driving at various speeds, the vehicle would shut off without warning. Upon investigation, the contact associated the failure with NHTSA Campaign Number: 15V194000 (Electrical System) however, the VIN was not included. The vehicle was not taken to a local dealer to be inspected. The manufacturer was informed of the failure and confirmed that the VIN was not included in the recall. The failure mileage was approximately 124,000.
The vehicle turned off in the drive gear. I lost steering,breaking and control of vehicle.

Hi - I have a 2010 VW Volkswagen that has an issue with headlights intermittently working, which is very hazardous and also the windshield wipers randomly turn on and the car was intermittently starting (now won’t start at all since 7/18/2021) among other things. Car appears to not be starting due to fuel relay with TIPM.  The intermittent headlights is very dangerous but corrects itself in a few days so mechanics haven’t been able to figure it out. This car is related to the several Chrysler models from 2010-2014  (it states Chrysler on various parts of my VW Routan) that had a recall for issues with the TIPM box, which appears to be the issue with my vehicle. As far as I can tell the same recall was not issued for the Routan. Why? I’ve found many similar descriptions of Routan owners that have had the same issues I have and these go back to the TIPM. Will there be a recall?   There is one of many links detailing people with the same issues/concerns. https://www.change.org/p/matthias-mueller-volkswagen-of-america-volkswagen-of-america-recall-the-routan-due-to-a-major-safety-issue my Vin is [XXX].  INFORMATION Redacted PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).

The contact owns a 2010 Volkswagen Routan. The contact stated while driving at various speeds the vehicle would shut off randomly. The contact stated traction control warning light was illuminated. Upon investigation, the contact associated the failure with NHTSA Campaign Number: 11V151000 (Electrical System) however, the Vin was not included. The vehicle was not diagnosed nor repaired. The manufacturer was informed of the failure but offered no assistance. The failure mileage was approximately 147,833.

2010 VW Routan VIN:[XXX]  We purchased the vehicle used in November of 2018. From November 2018 through early 2020, I experienced the car turning off while driving it about once every 4-6 months. When researching this issue we found that extra weight from other keys or keychains could be affecting it so we separated the car key from my house keys. This showed no improvement. From early 2020 through early 2021, the issue increased in frequency. Instead of once every 4-6 months it became once a month. And, unfortunately in the past 3 months, it has started occurring several times a week (sometimes multiple times a day). This has been a safety concern for our family and we are very nervous that this could cause a serious accident. Luckily the other vehicles around us when this occurs have been alert drivers that were able to give us the extra time to restart our vehicle. We realize that this won’t always be the case and need to get it fixed.   The issues we are experiencing as outlined above are in line with the issues listed in NHTSA Campaign ID: 11V151000 for other 2010 VW Routans. However, for whatever reason, our VIN number is not included in the recall. I would like to make a formal appeal with nhtsa that our vehicle be included in this recall and that it be repaired by VW as it is quite clear that what we are experiencing is from the issue in this NHTSA Recall Campaign. We are disappointed to be in a position to fight for something to get fixed that is quite clearly caused by a defaulted part, but remain hopeful that this will be resolved in a timely manner.   INFORMATION Redacted PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).

The contact owned a 2010 Volkswagen Routan. The contact stated while the vehicle was parked in the driveway, the vehicle independently caught on fire. There was no crash nor injury due to the fire. The air bags did not deploy. The fire department was contacted and was able to extinguish the fire. A police report was filed. The vehicle was not towed. The contact had an independent mechanic inspect the vehicle and deemed the vehicle as a total loss. The vehicle was destroyed. The manufacturer was not informed of the failure. The approximate failure mileage was 125,000.

I purchased this vehicle in March of 2015 when my vehicle shut down and rebooted itself while driving. Since 2019-present, my vehicle shuts off while driving and will restart back up maybe 5 mins, an hour or so later. The ABS, check engine, airbag, and other lights on the dashboards come on and remain on, in which, my car begins to make a beeping sound. the headlights, wipers, and sometimes my horn goes on and off by itself. When my vehicle shuts off, so does my ability to steer the wheel, it locks up. when I turn the air on in the car, my car begins to shake as well. Also, I have replaced my car battery, alternator, and starter two times this year and my vehicle still have the same issue.

The TIPM is failing which is a common issue with the vehicle make/model. My particular vehicle was not covered under any recalls, however, I have the same tell tale TIPM failure issues as all of the cars that were part of the recall. My lights intermittently work which causes a safety hazard. They will either not turn at all, will turn on and start flashing, or will appear to be working as normal until I'm driving and then they will flash off intermittently. This puts anyone in my car as well as oncoming traffic at risk when my lights malfunction at night. The airbag warning indicator light also flashes off and on as well making me think that it may be failing whenever the TIPM is not functioning properly. The door locks and windows have also locked/unlocked and opened/closed at random (even when the vehicle is off and has been parked with the power off for hours). I spoke with the mechanic about all of these issues and he verified that it was likely a failing TIPM and that it is a well-known issue with the Routan.  My vehicle is available for inspection any time. Volkswagen and Chrysler know that this is a common issue and yet they have put their customers in danger by not recalling all of the affected vehicles.   I am not sure what date to put as the date of incident as this has been ongoing since I have owned the vehicle. I put the current date (as it happened just today) and mileage, however, please understand that this has been an ongoing issue for years and Volkswagen has failed to include my vehicle in any recalls even though this is a well-known issue.

CAR SHUTS OFF WHILE DRIVING

THIS COMPLAINT INVOLVES A WELL-MAINTAINED MINIVAN WITH 65,000 MILES AND AN ENGINE THAT QUITS UNEXPECTEDLY WHILE IN MOTION, DISABLING THE POWER STEERING AND BRAKES.  AS DESCRIBED IN THE DEFECT NOTICE (PART 573 FILING), PUBLISHED 3/1/2011 AND AMENDED 5/10/2011, CITING RECALL CODE 28G/U8, THIS MINIVAN FALLS WITHIN THE APPLICABLE VIN RANGE AND BUILD DATES HOWEVER, VOLKSWAGEN REFUSES TO COVER THE REPAIR UNDER THE RECALL.  THE PROBLEMS WITH THE VEHICLE BEGAN APPROXIMATELY SIX MONTHS AGO WHEN THE ENGINE QUIT NUMEROUS TIMES, MOSTLY WHEN STATIONARY, RIGHT AFTER STARTING, BUT TWICE WHEN IN MOTION IN FREEWAY TRAFFIC.  IN ALL CASES, THE KEY WAS UNTOUCHED AND REMAINED IN THE ON POSITION AND THE DASH LIGHTS REMAINED ON.  LIKEWISE, IN ALL CASES, AFTER JIGGLING THE KEY, THE VEHICLE RESTARTED AND RAN NORMALLY.  ABOUT FOUR MONTHS AGO, A NEW PROBLEM SURFACED WHEREBY THE ENGINE WOULD NOT START UNTIL WE WIGGLED THE KEY FOR BETWEEN TWO AND TWENTY MINUTES.  MOST RECENTLY, AT THE END OF A TRIP, THE VEHICLE WILL NOT SHUT OFF.  THE ENGINE CONTINUES TO RUN, EVEN WITH THE KEY REMOVED. THIS PROBLEM PROMPTED US TO DELIVER THE CAR TO OUR LOCAL VW DEALER ON 12/26/2018 AND THEIR DIAGNOSTIC NOTES INCLUDE 'FOUND INTERNAL SEPARATION OF WIN MODULE.'  THEIR ESTIMATE IS FOR REPLACEMENT OF THE RECALLED ITEM, THE WIN MODULE.  IT SEEMS CLEAR THAT THE PROBLEM WITH THIS VEHICLE, AND THE PART NEEDED, BOTH MIRROR EXACTLY THAT WHICH IS DETAILED IN THE PART 573 NOTICE AND AS SUCH, SHOULD BE INCLUDED IN THE COVERED REPAIRS.  MOREOVER, IT IS EVIDENT THAT THE MANUFACTURER DID NOT ACCURATELY ASSESS THE EXTENT OF THE DEFECTIVE VEHICLE RANGE.  I ENCOURAGE THE NHTSA TO INTERVENE AND FORCE THIS MANUFACTURER TO PROPERLY ENSURE THE SAFETY OF THOSE DRIVING IN, OR AROUND, THESE VEHICLES.

THE DEALER WAS NOT NOTIFIED. THE MANUFACTURER STATED THAT THE VIN WAS NOT INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 15V194000 (ELECTRICAL SYSTEM). THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE TOTALLY INTEGRATED POWER MODULE (TIPM) IS DEFECTIVE CAUSING THE VEHICLE TO STALE WHILE IN-MOTION RESULTING IN LOSS OF POWER STEERING AND BRAKING AND NEAR MISSES.  THIS HAS OCCURRED WHILE VEHICLE WAS IN TRANSIT UP TO 45 MILES PER HOUR.  THE VEHICLE'S DVD SYSTEM STOPPED WORKING.  THE VEHICLE HAS FAILED TO START.  ALSO, WHILE MAKING TURNS, FROM A STOPPED POSITION, THE VEHICLE HAS STALED RESULTING IN NEAR MISSES WITH ONCOMING TRAFFIC.  WHILE STARTING THE VEHICLE, THE INTERIOR LIGHTS WOULD FLASH WHILE FAILING TO CRANK START.  THE STALING WHILE IN MOTION OCCURS MULTIPLE TIMES DAILY.  THE VEHICLE HAS BEEN TO THE MECHANIC AT LEAST 10 TIMES SINCE PURCHASING IT IN 2015.  THE VEHICLE HAS ALWAYS HAD THIS PROBLEM SINCE PURCHASING.  THE MOST RECENT VISIT TO THE MECHANIC CONCLUDED (2/2018) THE TIPM  TO BE DEFECTIVE AND THAT THE DODGE/CHRYSLER PRODUCTS WITH THE SAME TIPM PART IS ALREADY RECALLED YET THE VW SISTER-PRODUCT IS NOT RECALLED.  THE MECHANIC RECOMMEND REPLACING THE TIPM BECAUSE IT IS A SAFETY ISSUE AND WILL CONTINUE TO CAUSE STALING AT HIGH RATES OF SPEED, NEAR MISSES, IF THE PART IS NOT REPLACED.  THE COST TO REPLACE WAS APPROX. $1,500.00.  NHTSA NEEDS TO ISSUE A SAFETY RECALL FOR THE TIPM IN 2010 VW ROUTAN.

WHILE THE CAR IS BEING DRIVEN, AT TIMES THE ENGINE WILL CUT OUT, LEAVING THE CAR IN "ON" BUT WITH NO ENGINE POWER. WE THEN HAVE TO PULL THE STEERING WHEEL (WITH NO POWER STEERING BECAUSE THE ENGINE IS OFF) TO GET THE CAR TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD. WE THEN HAVE TO PUT THE CAR IN PARK TO START IT AGAIN. ALL OTHER SYSTEMS ARE STILL FUNCTIONING (IE RADIO), BUT ANYTHING RELATED TO THE ENGINE IS SHUT DOWN.  CAR CAN BE EASILY RESTARTED IN EITHER THE PARK OR NEUTRAL POSITION.  THIS PROBLEM, WHEN IT HAPPENS, USUALLY OCCURS WITHIN A FEW MINUTES OF STARTING THE CAR AND DRIVING.  HAS NOT HAPPENED DURING A DRIVE (MEANING THAT I HAVE BEEN DRIVING FOR A BIT).  THIS CAR WAS PART OF THE RECALL BACK IN 2011 AND HAD THE WIN MODULE REPLACED.  HOWEVER, EVEN THOUGH MY CAR WAS PART OF THE TARGET GROUP OF 2010 ROUTANS THAT WERE MANUFACTURED DURING THE RECALLED PERIOD, I AM NOT PART OF THE RECALL BECAUSE THE WIN MODULE WAS REPLACED BACK IN 2011.  WHAT IS FUNNY IS THAT 2009 MODELS WHO ALSO HAD THEIR WIN MODULES REPLACED DURING THE EARLIER RECALL CAN GET THE NECESSARY REPAIRS UNDER THIS NEW RECALL (15V194000).  I HAVE READ COMPLAINTS FROM OTHERS WITH SIMILAR ISSUES AS ME AND ALSO HAD THEIR CAR SERVICED UNDER THE PRIOR RECALL, AND WE CONTINUE TO HAVE THE SAME ISSUE OF THE ENGINE SHUTTING DOWN FOR NO REASON.  WHY ARE 2010 MODELS REPAIRED UNDER THE EARLIER RECALL EXCLUDED, BUT NOT 2009 RECALL-REPAIRED MODELS NOT?

WHILE DRIVING AT A SPEED OF 50 MPH ON A RURAL ROAD, THE FRONT DRIVER-SIDE TIRE INSTANTLY DEFLATED. FORTUNATELY, THE VEHICLE WAS SAFELY PULLED OVER AWAY FROM TRAFFIC. UPON EXAMINATION IT WAS FOUND THAT THE VALVE STEM HAD BROKEN OFF, AND THE TIRE HAD DEFLATED AS A RESULT. THE REST OF THE TIRE WAS IN GOOD CONDITION. IN THIS TYPE OF VEHICLE, THE TIRE PRESSURE MONITORING SYSTEM (TPMS) IS PART OF THE VALVE STEM, AND THAT IS WHAT HAD BROKEN OFF. THREE WEEKS PRIOR, I'D INSTALLED 4 NEW TIRES. RETURNING HOME FROM DR'S. OFFICE THIS DAY, I HEARD A SMALL 'POP', THEN BEGAN HEARING RUMBLING, THEN REALIZED CAR BEING PULLED TO EDGE OF ROAD. FLAT TIRE? ON A 3 WK OLD TIRE?   SURE ENOUGH THE RIGHT FRONT TIRE WAS FLAT. VERY FORTUNATE FOR LOCATION OF OCCURRENCE, SPEED ZONE, AND DISTANCE TO THE VERY PLACE I'D PURCHASED THE TIRES. THIS VEHICLE IS EQUIPPED WITH TPMS. THE SENSOR STEM IS HELD TIGHT TO THE EXTERIOR OF THE RIM WITH A METAL NUT. THE NUT HAD POPPED OFF WHILE DRIVING, THUS THE STEM RETRACTED TOWARDS THE INSIDE THE RIM / WHEEL AND RELEASED ALL THE AIR IN THE TIRE. THE THREADS ON THE STEM WERE CORRODED AWAY AND COULD NO LONGER HOLD THE NUT IN PLACE. I HAD TO PURCHASE A NEW TIRE. I DECIDED TO HAVE THE TIRE STORE LOOK AT THE OTHER 3 STEMS / NUTS ON THE OUTSIDE. ONLY ONE OF THE THREE REMAINING NUTS COULD BE LOOSENED. THE OTHER TWO WERE FUSED IN PLACED DUE TO CORROSION. I DECIDED TO HAVE REMOVE THE OTHER 3 STEMS REMOVED AS I DID NOT TRUST THEM ENOUGH TO PUT MY WIFE OR GRANDSONS, OR ANY PASSENGER IN THE VEHICLE WITH ME AFTER SEEING WHAT HAPPENED. HAD I BEEN SEEING ONE OF MY OTHER DOCTORS, TAKING ROUTE 531 AT THE 65MPH LIMIT, AND THIS HAD HAPPENED ON ONE OF THE SEVERAL SEVERE CURVES, I SHUDDER TO THINK WHAT MAY HAVE HAPPENED. THE SENSORS ACTUALLY ARE LABELED AS 'CHRYSLER' PRODUCT. I HAVE CALLED BOTH VWCARES AND CHRYSLER AND BROUGHT THIS TO THEIR ATTENTION. I HAVE WARNED AS MANY FAMILY AND FRIENDS AS POSSIBLE ABOUT THESE TPMS SENSORS AND STEMS, AND ADVISED THEM ALL TO INSPECT THEIRS REGULARLY. OUR SON IS A GM TECHNICIAN AND ADVISED US THAT GM ACTUALLY RECOGNIZED THEY NEEDED TO UPGRADE THEIR VALVE STEMS A FEW YEARS AGO TO PROTECT SUCH AN OCCURRENCE.     *TR

ON AUGUST 14TH, 2014, I PLACED MY KEY IN THE IGNITION OF MY 2010 VOLKSWAGEN ROUTAN.  THE CAR/ENGINE MADE AN ODD SOUND WHEN THE KEY WAS TURNED AND ALL THE LIGHTS WENT OUT.  ADDITIONALLY, THE DASH LIGHTS STARTED FLASHING AND MY KEY BECAME PERMANENTLY STUCK IN THE IGNITION.  I HEARD A VERY RAPID "CLICKING" NOISE UNDER THE HOOD SO I OPENED IT AND DISCOVERED THE FUSE BOX UNDER THE HOOD WAS THE SOURCE.  UPON OPENING IT, I HEARD A VERY FAST CLICKING SOUND AND FELT EACH FUSE AND FOUND THE LARGE FUSE, 2ND FROM THE LEFT FRONT WAS CLICKING VERY FAST AND LOUDLY.  I NEEDED THE VEHICLE SO I USED JUMPER CABLES AND THIS EVENTUALLY ENABLED MY CAR'S KEY TO RELEASE.  ALL THE WARNING LIGHTS WERE LIT UP AND I LEFT THE ENGINE RUN FOR APPROXIMATELY 8 MIN., THEN TURNED OFF THE CAR - TO VERIFY IT WOULD START AGAIN.  IT DID, AND NOW ONLY THE ENGINE WARNING LIGHT THAT LIGHTS UPON AN INCIDENT IS STILL LIT.  I CALLED MY CLOSEST VW DEALER, WHO HAS SERVICES MY CAR IN THE PAST, AND THEY CLAIMED NO KNOWLEDGE OF THE ISSUE AND STATED THE RECALL #66665 ELECTRICAL SYSTEM - IGNITION SWITCH - IS NOT APPLICABLE TO MY VEHICLE.  SURE IT ISN'T!  EXACT SAME ISSUE THAT IS NOTED IN THE RECALL, BUT SOMEHOW MY VEHICLE IS NOT ONE OF THE ONES AFFECTED.  I AM PURSUING THING WITH THE SERVICE MANAGER, BUT SO FAR ONLY PUSH BACK.   *TR

DRIVING ON A NEIGHBORHOOD STREET WHEN A SUDDEN DROP IN THE AC POWER FOLLOWED BY A QUICK RISE IN THE ENGINE TEMP TO THE TOP OF THE GAUGE. PLEASE CROSS REFERENCE THIS WITH ANY COMPLAINTS RELATED TO THE CHRYSLER TOWN AND COUNTRY MINIVAN AND THE DODGE GRAND CARAVAN AS THEY ARE ALL PRODUCED BY CHRYSLER CORP. I HAD THE FOLLOWING PROBLEM OCCUR WITHIN THE FIRST FEW MONTHS OF OWNING A 2010 ROUTAN.  (THE DEALERSHIP TOLD ME THAT IT WAS NOT A PROBLEM, RATHER THAT I WAS NOT FAMILIAR WITH THE WAY THE NEW TRANSMISSIONS WORK.)  WHEN THE CRUISE CONTROL IS SET NEAR 50 MPH AND THE VEHICLE GOES DOWNHILL IT WILL DOWNSHIFT AUTOMATICALLY AND THE ENGINE WILL INCREASE ITS RPMS, ESSENTIALLY CREATING A MOTOR-BRAKE THAT KEEPS THE SPEED LESS THAN ABOUT 55 MPH.  I ACCEPTED THEIR EXPLANATION AND THEIR ASSURANCE THAT IT WAS SAFE AND WOULD NOT DAMAGE THE VEHICLE.  I HAVE ONLY OBSERVED THIS HAPPENING AT SPEEDS NEAR 50MPH.  HOWEVER, THIS SUNDAY WHEN IT HAPPENED ON A PARTICULARLY LONG, WINDING HILL, I DECIDED THAT I WOULD PREFER TO MANUALLY USE THE BRAKE, SO AFTER IT BEGAN DOWNSHIFTING I PRESSED THE CRUISE CONTROL BUTTON TO TURN IT OFF.  IT DID NOT TURN OFF.  I PRESSED THE BUTTON SEVERAL MORE TIMES, BUT IT HAD NO EFFECT.  I PRESSED MY FOOT ON THE BRAKE, BUT THE VEHICLE STAYED IN THE LOWER GEAR WITH THE ENGINE REVVING AND IT APPEARED TO ME THAT THE BRAKE AND THE ENGINE WERE WORKING AGAINST ONE ANOTHER.  I DECIDED TO LET THE VEHICLE CONTROL ITSELF UNTIL WE RETURNED TO LEVEL GROUND.  ONCE WE REACHED LEVEL GROUND AND I COULD HEAR THE ENGINE BEGIN TO REDUCE ITS RPMS, I PRESSED ON THE BRAKE AND THE CRUISE CONTROL DISENGAGED.  THIS WAS SCARY BUT CONTROLLABLE BECAUSE THE ROAD WAS DRY AND THE ROAD, THOUGH STEEP, WAS WIDE AND EASY TO NAVIGATE. HOWEVER, ON A SNOWY OR WET ROAD, THIS WOULD HAVE BEEN A VERY DANGEROUS PROBLEM AND IF IT HAPPENS TO ANYONE ELSE THEY MAY PANIC AND DO SOMETHING EVEN MORE DANGEROUS.  THEN, AN ACCIDENT INVESTIGATOR WILL NOT REALIZE THE CAUSE OF THE ACCIDENT BECAUSE, AS IN MY CASE, THE CRUISE CONTROL WILL BE TURNED OFF.  BUT THE DRIVER WILL NOT HAVE BEEN IN CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE.  THIS, I BELIEVE IS A VERY UNSAFE SITUATION.  I HAVE NOT REPORTED THIS SUNDAY'S INCIDENT TO THE DEALER OR TO VW.

WHILE DRIVING ON A HIGHWAY AT 65 MPH MY CAR SUDDENLY SHUT OFF AND THE STEERING WHEEL TIGHTEN UP.  I WAS IN THE LEFT LANE AND WAS ABLE TO GET OVER TO THE SHOULDER.  I TURNED THE VEHICLE OFF AND IT TURNED BACK ON WITH NO PROBLEM.  A SECOND INCIDENT OCCURRED 03/09/11 AS I WAS ATTEMPTING TO TURN RIGHT AT AN INTERSECTION.  MY STEERING WHEEL WAS SO TIGHT THAT I COULD NOT MAKE THE TURN AND HAD TO DRIFT TO THE OTHER SIDE OF THE INTERSECTION BECAUSE I HAD ALREADY SLOWED DOWN TO MAKE THE TURN.  AGAIN THE CAR TURNED BACK ON.  MY CAR ALSO FREQUENTLY STALLS IMMEDIATELY UPON TURNING IT ON BUT I THOUGHT NOTHING OF IT UNTIL IT STARTED STALLING WHILE DRIVING.  I TOOK IT IN FOR SERVICE AND WAS TOLD THAT THEY COULD NOT REPLICATE THE PROBLEM AND THAT THE COMPUTER WAS NOT INDICATING A PROBLEM.  THEREFORE THE CAR WAS FINE AND I SHOULD COME AND PICK IT UP.  I INFORMED THEM WHEN I DROPPED THE CAR OFF THAT I READ ONLINE THAT THERE WAS A PENDING RECALL FOR THE IGNITION SWITCH THAT WAS RELEASED ON 03/10/11; HOWEVER, THE DEALERSHIP INFORMED ME THAT THEY COULD NOT REPLACE THE IGNITION SWITCH UNTIL THE RECALL WAS OFFICIAL SOMETIME IN APRIL BECAUSE THEY WOULD NOT BE REIMBURSED.  I HAVE FILED A COMPLIANT WITH VW AND AM WAITING FOR A RESPONSE FROM THE REGIONAL MANAGER.

I PURCHASED A 2010 VW ROUTAN IN MAY 2010.  I HAVE HAD MULTIPLE ISSUES WITH THE VEHICLE SINCE THAT TIME - ELECTRICAL ISSUES WITH THE SLIDING DOORS, TRANSMISSION NOT SHIFTING CORRECTLY, THE VEHICLE'S STRAINED ABILITY TO BACK UP WHEN STOPPED/PARKED ON A DECLINE.  THE ONLY ISSUE WHICH HAS BEEN SATISFACTORILY ADDRESSED TO DATE IS THE SLIDING DOOR ELECTRICAL ISSUE.  MY MOST PRESSING CONCERN, HOWEVER, INVOLVES A STALLING ISSUE WHICH OCCURS WITHOUT WARNING AND WITHOUT ANY PARTICULAR PATTERN.  ON SEPTEMBER 2, 2010, WHILE TRAVELING ON THE INTERSTATE AT APPX 60 MPH THE VEHICLE STALLED OUT.  FORTUNATELY, MY HUSBAND WAS DRIVING AND WAS ABLE TO PULL THE VEHICLE TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD.  ONCE STOPPED, THE VEHICLE RESTARTED WITHOUT TROUBLE AND WE WERE ABLE TO REACH A SAFE LOCATION TO CALL THE DEALERSHIP.  THE DEALERSHIP HAS BEEN UNABLE TO IDENTIFY ANY PROBLEMS WITH THE VEHICLE AS THEY SAY THE "DIAGNOSTIC TESTS" SHOW NOTHING IS WRONG AND THAT IT IS OPERATING ACCORDING TO THE MANUFACTURER DESIGN.  I PURCHASED THIS VEHICLE IN LARGE PART TO THE VW HIGH SAFETY RATING, YET, I AM NOT CONVINCED THIS VEHICLE LIVES UP TO THAT STANDARD. I PREVIOUSLY OWNED A VW PASSAT PRIOR TO THE PURCHASE OF THE ROUTAN AND WAS VERY PLEASED.  HOWEVER, I CANNOT SAY THE SAME ABOUT MY EXPERIENCE WITH THE ROUTAN.  A VEHICLE THAT STALLS WITHOUT EXPLANATION IS A SAFETY CONCERN WHICH I WOULD HOPE WOULD BE INVESTIGATED AND ADDRESSED IMMEDIATELY.  *TR

OUR 2010 VW ROUTAN ROLLS BACK SEVERELY ON EVEN A SLIGHT INCLINE WHEN IN DRIVE OR REVERSE.  THE DEALER'S TECH AGREED IT WAS ABNORMAL AND THE SERVICE MANAGER THOUGHT SO, TOO, BUT, ACCORDING TO VW SPECS, IT IS "NORMAL."  WE FEAR THAT ON AN INCLINE STOP, SUCH AS AT A STOP SIGN, IT WILL ROLL BACK AND HIT THE CAR BEHIND US OR ANY PERSON/OBJECT BEHIND US.  WHEN IN REVERSE ON AN INCLINE, WE FEAR HITTING SOMEONE/SOMETHING IN FRONT OF THE CAR, BECAUSE OF ITS PROPENSITY TO ROLL FORWARD.  THERE IS NOT ENOUGH TIME FOR ONE TO GET ONE'S FOOT FROM THE BRAKE PEDAL TO THE GAS TO MAKE IT SAFE ENOUGH TO DRIVE.  THE COMPANY HAS CONVEYED TO US THAT OUR ONLY RECOURSE IS THROUGH THE DEALER, AND WE'VE DONE THAT WITH NO SATISFACTION FOR OUR SAFETY CONCERNS.  THEY SAY "THEY ALL DO THIS," AND IF THAT'S THE CASE, WE BELIEVE THEY ARE "ALL" UNSAFE. *TR

THIS COMPLAINT IS REGARDING MY NEW 2010 VOLKSWAGEN ROUTAN, THE CAR IS UNDER TWO MONTHS OLD.     THE ACCIDENT OCCURRED AFTER I PULLED INTO MY DRIVEWAY AND I PUT THE CAR IN PARK AND LEFT THE KEYS IN THE ENGINE BECAUSE I WAS GOING TO RUN INTO OPEN THE GARAGE.... I WANTED TO GET A PUPPY OUT OF THE REAR OF THE CAR FIRST SO I WENT AND STOOD BEHIND THE CAR BUT IT WAS LOCKED (CLEARLY IN PARKED.) I THEN WENT TO THE DRIVERS SIDE TO HIT THE UNLOCK SWITCH ON THE DOOR AND THE CAR STARTED REVERSING AND I WAS JUST CAUGHT REALLY OFF GUARD SO I TRIED TO JUMP IN THE CAR AS IT WAS BACKING UP BUT I GUESS MY REACTION WAS TOO LATE AND I ENDED UP BEING SHOVED ON THE PAVEMENT AS THE CAR ROLLED OUT OF OUR DRIVEWAY. AT THIS POINT I WAS CAUGHT UNDER THE OPEN DRIVERS DOOR AND I WAS DRAGGED ACROSS MY STREET.... I MANAGED TO GET OUT FROM UNDER THE DOOR. THANKFULLY OUR NEIGHBORHOOD HAS DEEP GUTTERS, I WAS ABLE TO CATCH UP TO THE CAR AND I MANAGE TO JUMP IN BECAUSE OF THE STALL THE GUTTER CREATED. THE CAR NEARLY RAN THROUGH THE NEIGHBOR'S GARAGE AND JUST MISSED THEIR MAILBOX.     I HAVE NO IDEA HOW THE CAR COULD GO FROM A CLEARLY "PARKED" POSITION TO "REVERSE" ON IT'S OWN.    I HAVE ROAD RASH ON MY TOES, FEET, KNEES (MY JEANS ARE WRECKED), ON MY HIPS AND ON MY SHOULDERS. I HAVE BRUISES FROM THE DOOR BEING CAUGHT ON MY LEG, MY ENTIRE LEG IS SWOLLEN.     AFTER THE INCIDENT I IMMEDIATELY CALLED THE LOCAL POLICE DEPARTMENT AND FILED A REPORT.  *TR
